name: The Drawing Room at the Prince of Wales Hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I have treated ourselves to High Tea at the Prince of Wales Hotel in Niagara on the Lake several times in the past and it NEVER disappoints. Our most recent reservation was October 12th mid day. The best way to describe the drawing room is cozy yet elegant and the service, food and presentation are top notch! When we want to treat a family member or friend to a special meal, this is top of our list. It is just that, a lovely treat that needs to be experienced. If you're in Niagara on the Lake on a date, anniversary trip or simply walking the the shops for an afternoon...consider tea at the Drawing Room and watch the world go by. If you do make your reservation, request the Solarium and also ask if Grace will be there because she is an incredible Server. Tell her we said hello!

reviews.text: Keep up the great work. Once you go once you are hooked!

reviews.text: As I was by myself at a coffee table with two other ladies who were friends, a tiered cake plate for one, was placed in front of me. It all looked very nice BUT I would prefer to choose my own sandwiches and pastries and didn't particularly like what was served to me.

My husband and I treat ourselves a couple times a year to High Tea at the Prince of Wales Hotel. From the moment you are welcomed to the Drawing Room till the final sip of tea it is a truly lovely experience that is a must if you are in Niagara on the Lake for a visit. There are a variety of teas and finger food selections to choose from that are presented in the style of a forgotten time. If you are a fan of the PBS drama Downton Abby, you’ll feel like you’re sitting in the Grantham home sipping tea with royalty.
reviews.title: High Tea at the Drawing Room - A Must
Dinner in Style
reviews.text: The presentation is top notch, the service is exceptional and the atmosphere is relaxing. For our last three visits we have been lucky enough to have Grace as our Server. She always remembers us and welcomes us back, does a fantastic job with presentation and clearing our table, is always friendly, and represents the best of the best at The Prince of Wales. Simply put each customer is made to feel special, appreciated and welcome. We wouldn’t hesitate to recommend High Tea at the Prince of Wales or better yet, treat yourselves to a weekend escape…the hotel itself is GORGEOUS!!!!!
Say hello to Grace for us and have a fantastic time!

reviews.text: We loved the decor and the richness of history of this building and the food was nothing less than excellent. From our soup and salad to our entree and then coffee and dessert, we couldn't be more pleased. We come here every time we travel to Canada from the US.

reviews.text: A colleague from home told me I had to visit the Prince of Wales Hotel for afternoon tea when we came to Niagara and so we set off we empty stomachs to do just that. After the trashy appearance of Niagara Falls establishments, Niagara on the Lake is such a treasure and only a 30 minute drive away. The heritage listed buildings in the town are a delight and the Prince of Wales is no exception, being reminiscent of stately homes and hotels in England. As we were there in the off season, there were only two other tables occupied for afternoon tea and we were asked whether we would like to sit in the cosy room with the open fire or in the glass encased conservatory. We chose the latter and it was such a delightful setting in which to partake of the delicious sandwiches and cakes, plus giant scones with jam and cream which arrived on a three tiered plate stand. There were eleven different teas on offer and my husband and I chose different blends so we received a large pot each. The crockery is Wedgewood and the napery thick starched linen, adding to the English feel of the place. Our waitress was friendly and attentive without being intrusive and when we couldn't finish all our food, offered to put the rest in a box to take away with us. We did that and were able to enjoy the rest of our tasty morsels later in the evening. We definitely didn't need any dinner that night so at $33 each, it proved to be value for money. Also available for afternoon tea is a selection of wines and cheeses so that would make for an even more substantial meal.

reviews.title: Wonderul Victorian Tea!
reviews.text: What a delight! High tea in a lovely Victorian setting. The hostess brought us to a wonderful table, very comfortable chairs. We had tea on 2/21 so thank you to the hostess for that day. Food was wonderful and plentiful. Many choices to choose from for tea as well.

Amazing ambiance, luscious surroundings, great service. We chose the Monarch tea service, which includes incredible Canadian cheeses and a Kir Royal coctail. The cheeses were absolutely delightful, the scones were delectable, and our hostess Grace was a perfect blend of friendly and attentive. Will definitely return.
reviews.title: Afternoon tea

reviews.text: We had afternoon tea on a Saturday afternoon. Tea selection was a little limited but the ones they had were excellent. Plenty of sandwiches and desserts and the warm biscuit served was huge. We chose the basic tea which was $32.00 per person. A little pricey but as I said plenty of refills on the tea and lots leftover on our tray. They don't rush you and the room itself is something out of the past with small beautiful settees and fine china. Would do it again. We were a party of eight including men who found it enjoyable too. Champagne is available too if your interested.
reviews.title: Lovely Atmosphere

reviews.text: We have had afternoon tea in London - the experience in The Drawing Room is authentic! Will not disappoint. Bring a healthy appetite!

High Tea on a snowy afternoon....
reviews.text: 4pm High Tea - amazing scones, piping hot tea(great selection). Service was warm and friendly. Not cheap, bt u have to do it when you're there!!

We recently held a small Bridal Shower celebrating "Sweet Beginnings" in the sunny solarium area of the elegant Drawing Room. We enjoyed gifting the 'Bride-to- Be' with the items from the Traditional Victorian poem ~ "Something Old.." and our guest of Honor truly felt like Royalty at the Prince of Wales. We all felt we had stepped back in time to the Victorian era with roses everywhere and lovely floral tea services gracing each table. Plenty of warm scones with clotted cream, finger sandwiches, chocolate dipped strawberries.. it was a perfect setting for a quaint bridal shower. We would like to thank Lisa and Sandra for their warm,attentive service and great kindness. Our 'Bride' surely felt like a princess and it truly was a "Sweet Beginning" for her new life.
reviews.title: "Something Old, Something New.."
Overnight stay was nice but the high tea was dissapointing
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend away in the summer. The room was nice if a touch dated. The bed was comfortable and the breakfast very good.

Visited for afternoon tea as a treat and was not so impressed really. The tea was good and served in nice china. The scones were poor and the cakes a little dry. It was not the fabulous experience I expected.
reviews.title: High tea a true treat

reviews.text: We started our weekend in NOTL with afternoon high tea and it was the perfect way to kick things off. We sat in the solarium on a gloomy day and found it really cozy and comfortable. Our service was excellent, we were encouraged to stay as long as we wanted, and all our food was great. Highly recommend this experience.
reviews.title: Tasting Adventure
Best High Tea on Earth!!!
reviews.text: Beautiful decor, such a treat anywhere you sit and then to have food and service that matched; what a treat! My friend and split the soup; so good (!) we regretted it. The lunch that followed equally divine. And with 2 glasses of wine, what ended a beautiful experience was the most reasonable price - under $55 for two. Just a nice weekday drive with lunch and a walk around.

it was a splurge on our anniversary, but worth it. Thanks to Grace for her excellent service. Scones to die for, delicious tea. My only critique is that they should play classical music, befitting the ambiance of high tea, and NOT crappy smooth jazz.
